Headline: Facebook to buy back additional $9 billion of shares
Article: Facebook Inc  will buy back an additional $9 billion of its shares  as it looks to pacify investors following a slump in its stock.

Article: Dec 7 Facebook Inc will buy back an additional $9 billion of its shares  as it looks to pacify investors following a slump in its stock.

Headline: India government meets with WhatsApp over tracing of fake news: source
Article: MUMBAI Indian tech ministry officials met with senior WhatsApp executives this week to ask the Facebook Inc  unit to start tracing the origins of misinformation spread through its messaging platform  a senior government official said on Friday.

Headline: Australia passes bill to force tech firms to hand over encrypted data
Article: SYDNEY Australia's parliament on Thursday passed a bill to force tech firms such as Alphabet Inc's Google   Facebook  and Apple  to give police access to encrypted data  the most far-reaching such requirements imposed by a western country.

Headline: Facebook board backs Sandberg's request to initiate research into Soros
Article: Facebook Inc's  board backed Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg's request to probe whether George Soros had shorted the company's stock after the billionaire investor called the social network a "menace to society."

Headline: Facebook gave data on user's friends to certain companies: documents
Article: Facebook Inc  let some companies  including Netflix  and Airbnb  access users' lists of friends after it cut off that data for most other apps around 2015  according to documents released on Wednesday by a British lawmaker investigating fake news and social media. | Video

Headline: UPDATE 4-Facebook gave data on user's friends to certain companies -documents
Article: Dec 5 Facebook Inc offered some companies  including Netflix and Airbnb  access to data about users' friends it did not make available to most other apps in 2015  according to documents released by a British lawmaker who said the social media company dodged questions about privacy practices and market dominance.

Headline: UPDATE 1-Facebook board backs Sandberg's request to initiate research into Soros
Article: Dec 5 Facebook Inc's board backed Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg's request to probe whether George Soros had shorted the company's stock after the billionaire investor called the social network a "menace to society."

Article: Dec 5 Facebook Inc's board backed Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg's handling of research into investor George Soros  the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday  citing a letter from the board.

Headline: Instagram's new feature allows users to share stories with smaller group
Article: Facebook Inc's Instagram said on Friday it launched a new feature dubbed "Close Friends" allowing users to share their stories with a smaller group of people.

Article: Nov 30 Facebook Inc's Instagram said on Friday it launched a new feature dubbed "Close Friends" allowing users to share their stories with a smaller group of people.

Headline: Facebook starts verification for UK political ads
Article: UK advertisers seeking to run political ads on Facebook Inc  must now confirm their identity  location and reveal who paid for the ad  the social network said on Thursday as it faces increasing scrutiny following the Cambridge Analytica scandal.

Headline: UPDATE 2-Amazon's treatment of sellers comes under scrutiny in Germany

Article: BERLIN  Nov 29 Germany's antitrust authority has launched an investigation into whether U.S. ecommerce giant Amazon is exploiting its market dominance in its relations with third-party retailers who use its website as a marketplace.

Headline: U.S. rights groups seek secret documents in Facebook encryption case

Headline: Facebook to expand its section for local news 'Today In'
Article: Facebook Inc  on Wednesday said it is expanding its 'Today In' feature  a dedicated section for local news and starting a test for local alerts from relevant government pages.

Headline: Former Facebook worker says firm not doing enough to deal with racial discrimination
Article: A former Facebook Inc  employee who worked closely with racial minority groups said in a blog post https://www.facebook.com/notes/mark-s-luckie/facebook-is-failing-its-black-employees-and-its-black-users/1931075116975013 on Tuesday that he left this month over frustration with the social network's "systematic disenfranchisement of underrepresented voices" and other diversity issues.

Headline: Upended by frat boys: International lawmakers slam Facebook's effect on politics

Headline: DoubleLine's Gundlach: Now is the time for capital preservation
Article: NEW YORK Jeffrey Gundlach  who runs DoubleLine Capital  said on Tuesday that investors should focus on capital preservation and avoid corporate bonds and Treasuries as inflationary pressures intensify.

Article: NEW YORK  Nov 20 Jeffrey Gundlach  who runs DoubleLine Capital  said on Tuesday that investors should focus on capital preservation and avoid corporate bonds and Treasuries as inflationary pressures intensify.

Headline: Singapore lawmaker blasts Facebook over refusal to take down 'false' post
Article: SINGAPORE A Singapore lawmaker hit out at Facebook  on Tuesday  saying it had reneged on a promise to help rein in fake news and calling for tougher regulations  which the social media firm has cautioned against.

Headline: Facebook to fund trainee local newspaper reporters in Britain
Article: LONDON Facebook is donating 4.5 million pounds ($5.8 million) to train journalists in Britain to support communities that have lost local newspapers and reporters  in no little part due to ad revenue and readers switching online to the social media giant.

Headline: UPDATE 1-Facebook to fund trainee local newspaper reporters in Britain
Article: LONDON  Nov 19 Facebook is donating 4.5 million pounds ($5.8 million) to train journalists in Britain to support communities that have lost local newspapers and reporters  in no little part due to ad revenue and readers switching online to the social media giant.

Headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT- S&P  Dow gain; Nasdaq dragged down by Nvidia  Facebook
Article: Nov 16 The S&P 500 and Dow Industrials rose on Friday after President Donald Trump said the United States may not have to impose further tariffs on Chinese goods  but declines in shares of Nvidia Corp  Amazon.com Inc and Facebook Inc helped to drag down the Nasdaq.

Headline: Facebook defends Russia response  updates plan to curb misbehavior
Article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc  Chairman and Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg on Thursday defended his response to Russian election meddling on the world's largest social media network and issued a new plan aimed at stifling misbehavior while maintaining a vibrant hub for online speech.

Headline: Breakingviews - Mark Zuckerberg pushes wrong kind of independence
Article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg is pushing the wrong kind of independence. The social network’s chief executive on Thursday revealed he plans to set up an external committee to help police fake news and hateful content. The move follows yet more revelations about how poorly he and others dealt with Russian meddling in U.S. elections. Outsourcing decisions won’t fix Facebook’s culture  though. Removing Zuckerberg as chair would be a step in the right direction.

Headline: U.S. senator to query Facebook about report on treatment of critics
Article: WASHINGTON A Democratic U.S. senator said on Thursday she will ask Facebook Inc  and the Justice Department about a media report that the company hired an outside firm to attack critics  warning that such action could raise campaign finance issues.

Headline: France to 'embed' regulators at Facebook to combat hate speech
Article: PARIS Facebook  will allow French regulators to "embed" inside the company to examine how it combats online hate speech  the first time the wary tech giant has opened its doors in such a way  President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday.

Headline: France to "embed" regulators at Facebook in fight against hate speech
Article: PARIS  Nov 12 In the first move of its kind  Facebook will allow a small number of French regulators to "embed" inside the company and examine how the social media giant combats hate speech online  President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday.

Headline: SAP snatches sentiment tracker Qualtrics from verge of IPO for $8 billion
Article: FRANKFURT German business software company SAP  has agreed to buy Qualtrics International for $8 billion in cash  pre-empting a planned stock market listing by the U.S.-based company which specializes in tracking online sentiment. | Video

Headline: Facebook to quadruple size of Dublin international headquarters

Headline: Facebook to quadruple size of Dublin international headquarters
Article: DUBLIN  Nov 8 Facebook has taken on a long-term lease in Dublin which will quadruple the floor space at its international headquarters and allow the company to more than double its current staff of over 4 000.

Headline: Facebook blocks more accounts potentially linked to foreign entity
Article: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it blocked more accounts  in addition to the about 115 accounts it blocked over the weekend  in the run up to the U.S. midterm elections that saw democrats capture U.S. House majority.

Article: SAN FRANCISCO Public databases that shine a light on online political ads - launched by Facebook and Google before Tuesday's U.S. elections - offer the public the first broad view of how quickly the companies yank advertisements that break their rules.

Article: Nov 7 Facebook Inc said on Tuesday that it blocked more accounts after a website claiming to be associated with Russia-based Internet Research agency published a list of Instagram accounts they claimed to have created.

Headline: NBC  Fox News  Facebook pull Trump campaign ad linking immigration  crime
Article: NEW YORK NBC  Fox News and Facebook  pulled a campaign ad linking a caravan of Central American migrants and a cop killer  which U.S. President Donald Trump endorsed and CNN deemed "racist " the media companies said on Monday. The primetime TV ads on NBC  paid for by Donald J. Trump for President  ran during a "Sunday Night Football" broadcast.

Headline: Facebook's Cameroon problem: stop online hate stoking conflict
Article: YAOUNDE A video link posted on Facebook on June 20 showed a man cooking human body parts in a pot over a wood fire.

Article: * The personal data of 257 000 Facebook users  including the private messages of 81 000 users  has been freely available online since early September  shared by what may be Russian hackers  a BBC Russian Service investigation said on Friday.

Article: Nov 2 Shares in Apple Inc fell 6 percent on Friday  cutting its market value back to less than $1 trillion after it forecast softer-than-expected sales for the holiday quarter and fueled nerves over iPhone sales by saying it would no longer release the figures.

Headline: Facebook expects rising costs to combat scandals to moderate after 2019
Article: Facebook Inc  on Tuesday relieved investors by forecasting that margins would stop shrinking after 2019 as costs from scandals ease up  sending shares up despite a second-straight quarter with record-low user growth. | Video

Article: Oct 30 Facebook Inc on Tuesday relieved investors by forecasting that margins would stop shrinking after 2019 as costs from scandals ease up  sending shares up despite a second-straight quarter with record-low user growth.

Headline: Breakingviews - Facebook heads into an earnings pincer movement
Article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Facebook is heading into an earnings pincer movement. Sales growth at the $410 billion social-media network slowed in the third quarter  the company said on Tuesday. Combating that and other problems means spending more  hitting both top and bottom lines. That may force Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg to take rash countermeasures.

Headline: CORRECTED-UPDATE 4-Facebook's rise in profit outweighs slow user  sales growth
Article: Oct 30 Facebook Inc on Tuesday beat profit estimates but missed targets for growing monthly users and reported its slowest revenue growth in about six years in a quarter some investors feared would be hit harder by defections from the social media site.

Headline: Facebook misses estimates for monthly users  revenue
Article: Oct 30 Facebook Inc on Tuesday missed estimates for quarterly user growth and revenue but topped profit expectations as the social network tries to recover from privacy and content scandals.

Headline: Britain to target online giants with new 'Digital Services Tax'

Headline: UK austerity ending  as long as Brexit deal gets done: Hammond
Article: LONDON Finance minister Philip Hammond held out the prospect of an end to Britain's long spending squeeze provided the government secures a Brexit deal with the EU  putting pressure on the divided Conservative Party to back Prime Minister Theresa May. | Video

Headline: Norway wealth fund's China investments bound to grow  says CEO
Article: OSLO Norway's $970-billion sovereign wealth fund will inevitably step up its investments in China in tandem with other major global funds  but that process could take a decade rather than a couple of years  its CEO said.

Headline: California will not enforce state net neutrality law pending appeal
Article: WASHINGTON The state of California on Friday agreed not to enforce its own state net neutrality law until a final court decision on the Trump administration's decision to overturn the 2015 Obama-era open internet rules.

Headline: Breakingviews - Amazon’s ad initiative is a useful add-on item
Article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Amazon’s ad initiative is proving useful. The company’s third-quarter sales mainly pertaining to advertising – the “other” category  officially – soared. As a challenger to Facebook and Alphabet  both mired in data scandals  Jeff Bezos’ firm risks negative attention by plunging into the advertising business and targeting users. But the extra dough helps  and thanks to other revenue streams  Amazon has less to lose.

Headline: Google  Facebook executives meet with UK government over no-deal Brexit - Telegraph

Article: Facebook Inc's new searchable database of U.S. political ads reveals that companies such as Exxon Mobil Corp  Ben & Jerry's and Penzeys Spices are cumulatively spending millions of dollars to encourage voting and influence how Americans vote.

Headline: Facebook launches searchable database for U.S. political ad spending

Headline: Facebook's WhatsApp says no plan to lift forwarding limit in Brazil

Article: BRASILIA Facebook Inc's  WhatsApp messaging service became the frontline in Brazil's bitter presidential campaign on Friday  as front-runner Jair Bolsonaro angrily denied accusations he had encouraged widespread misinformation campaigns on the platform.

Headline: With presidency in sight  Brazil's Bolsonaro stumbles with campaign finance allegation
Article: RIO DE JANEIRO Earlier this week  Brazil's far-right presidential candidate Jair Bolsonaro said the presidency was "within reach." Just a day later though  Bolsonaro had to deny he had indulged in the same skullduggery he has often accused his leftist opponents of masterminding.

Headline: Facebook tentatively concludes spammers were behind recent data breach: WSJ

Headline: At Facebook  public funds join push to remove Zuckerberg as chairman

Headline: MTV reboots 'The Real World' series on Facebook in studio push
Article: Viewers may finally be able to vote the next Puck  the notoriously obnoxious housemate of "MTV's The Real World " off the show.

Headline: Exclusive: Facebook to ban misinformation on voting in upcoming U.S. elections
Article: MENLO PARK  Calif. Facebook Inc will ban false information about voting requirements and fact-check fake reports of violence or long lines at polling stations ahead of next month's U.S. midterm elections  company executives told Reuters  the latest effort to reduce voter manipulation on its service. | Video

Headline: Facebook now says data breach affected 29 million users  details impact
Article: Cyber attackers stole data from 29 million Facebook accounts using an automated program that moved from one friend to the next  Facebook Inc  announced on Friday  as the social media company said its largest-ever data theft hit fewer than the 50 million profiles it initially reported. | Video

Headline: UPDATE 5-Facebook now says data breach affected 29 mln users  details impact
Article: Oct 12 Cyber attackers stole data from 29 million Facebook accounts using an automated program that moved from one friend to the next  Facebook Inc announced on Friday  as the social media company said its largest-ever data theft hit fewer than the 50 million profiles it initially reported.

Headline: Amazon says 'breathtaking' class in Facebook job ads age-bias case should be rejected
Article: Amazon.com Inc on Thursday told a federal judge in San Jose  California that a proposed class of millions of older Facebook users suing the online retailer because they allegedly were not shown job ads would include an "infinite variety" of people and should be rejected.

Headline: WhatsApp builds system to comply with India's payments data storage norms

Headline: WhatsApp builds system to comply with India's payments data storage norms

Headline: Breakingviews - Facebook is late to fight second existential crisis
Article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Facebook is late to fighting an existential threat for the second time in its 14-year life. Poor security  low-quality content and excessive advertising are as big a danger to Mark Zuckerberg’s company as the 2012 growth of mobile. Facebook finally appears focused on the threat  but it won’t be as easy to solve via acquisitions and improved apps.

Headline: Global stocks get lift from oil prices; Fed bets boost dollar

Headline: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Wall St ends up slightly  but Facebook falls again

Headline: Breakingviews - Cox: Dual-class buyers’ early remorse at Facebook
Article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Six years ago  when Facebook was going public  investors bent over backwards to grant Mark Zuckerberg near-totalitarian power over the social network he founded in his Harvard dorm room by letting him hold special super-voting stock. The reasoning was that the young chairman and chief executive needed "runway" to build Facebook  without the pesky distractions most public companies face from unwashed shareholder hordes.

Headline: Facebook data controversy drives stock to cheap levels
Article: NEW YORK  March 20 The dive in Facebook Inc's shares may have created a rare buying opportunity for the high-flying social media company's stock - if investors believe a growing controversy over use of personal data will not severely damage the company's financial outlook.

Headline: Breakingviews - Europe’s data tax war is worthy but hard to win
Article: LONDON (Reuters Breakingviews) - Where should multinational tech companies pay income tax? Changing international rules devised a century ago will be difficult  but Europe is right that asset-light  data-hungry businesses like Google and Facebook  merit fresh thinking.

Headline: Breakingviews - Cox: Dual-class buyers’ early remorse at Facebook
Article: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Six years ago  when Facebook was going public  investors bent over backwards to grant Mark Zuckerberg near-totalitarian power over the social network he founded in his Harvard dorm room by letting him hold special super-voting stock. The reasoning was that the young chairman and chief executive needed "runway" to build Facebook  without the pesky distractions most public companies face from unwashed shareholder hordes.

Article: NEW YORK  July 25 Global equity markets eased and the dollar fell on Thursday after mixed results from blue-chip companies on both sides of the Atlantic and renewed concerns about the slowing pace of growth in China weighed on investor sentiment.

Headline: US STOCKS-Tech buoys Nasdaq  but earnings curb Dow and S&P 500
Article: NEW YORK  July 25 U.S. stocks edged higher on Thursday  rebounding off earlier weakness as strength in technology companies  especially Facebook  lifted the Nasdaq.

Headline: REFILE-US STOCKS-Dow  S&P fall on mixed earnings  Nasdaq likes Facebook
Article: * Facebook's best daily percentage gain ever keeps Nasdaq aloft

Headline: Irish watchdog won't probe U.S. firms over Prism
Article: VIENNA A watchdog in Ireland  home to the European headquarters of Apple and Facebook  says it will not investigate them for transferring personal data to a U.S. spy agency because they have signed up to EU privacy principles.

Headline: Irish watchdog won't probe U.S. firms over Prism
Article: * Says U.S. tech firms in Ireland signed up to EU data rules

Headline: UPDATE 1-Facebook shares jump 28%  Wall Street sees more ad growth
Facebook shares soar as users  mobile ads climb
Article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc delivered strong evidence it can thrive on smartphones and tablets on Wednesday  reporting a much better-than-anticipated surge in mobile advertising revenue in the second quarter that ignited a 20 percent share rally.

Headline: UPDATE 3-Facebook shares soar as users  mobile ads climb
Article: SAN FRANCISCO  July 24 Facebook Inc  delivered strong evidence it can thrive on smartphones and tablets on Wednesday  reporting a much better-than-anticipated surge in mobile advertising revenue in the second quarter that ignited a 20 percent share rally.

Headline: US STOCKS-Dow  S&P dip; Apple's jump keeps Nasdaq barely in black
Article: * Dow down 0.2 pct  S&P 500 off 0.4 pct  Nasdaq up 0.01 pct

Headline: UPDATE 1-Facebook Q2 revenue grows 53 percent
Article: July 24 Facebook Inc's revenue in the second quarter increased 53 percent  surpassing Wall Street targets  as the Internet company continued to grow its mobile ads business.

Headline: Facebook Q2 revenue grows
Article: July 24 Facebook Inc said revenue in the second quarter was $1.813 billion  compared to $1.184 billion in the year ago period.

Headline: Facebook blogger goads Zimbabwe's ruling party
Article: JOHANNESBURG A mysterious Facebook blogger purporting to be a disgruntled "Deep Throat" in President Robert Mugabe's party has become an unlikely election campaign star in Zimbabwe  attracting 275 000 online followers and the fury of the ZANU-PF establishment.

Headline: Facebook blogger goads Zimbabwe's ruling party
Article: JOHANNESBURG  July 23 A mysterious Facebook blogger purporting to be a disgruntled "Deep Throat" in President Robert Mugabe's party has become an unlikely election campaign star in Zimbabwe  attracting 275 000 online followers and the fury of the ZANU-PF establishment.

Headline: UPDATE 1-Apple  Google  dozens of others urge U.S. surveillance disclosures
Article: July 18 Dozens of companies  non-profits and trade organizations including Apple Inc  Google Inc  and Facebook Inc sent a letter on Thursday pushing the Obama administration and Congress for more disclosures on the government's national security-related requests for user data.

Article: Dozens of companies  non-profits and trade organizations including Apple Inc  Google Inc and Facebook Inc sent a letter Thursday pushing the Obama administration and Congress for more disclosures on the government's national security-related requests for user data.

Headline: Facebook mobile users jumped around 20 percent in U.S.  UK in June
Article: LONDON The number of users accessing Facebook via their mobile phones in June jumped around 20 percent in the United States and Britain  the social network said  touting its appeal for brands trying to reach consumers during the summer months.

Headline: Facebook mobile users jumped around 20 pct in US  UK in June
Article: LONDON  July 18 The number of users accessing Facebook via their mobile phones in June jumped around 20 percent in the United States and Britain  the social network said  touting its appeal for brands trying to reach consumers during the summer months.

Headline: Fugitive Snowden to seek temporary asylum in Russia
Article: MOSCOW Fugitive former intelligence contractor Edward Snowden  camped at a Moscow airport out of the reach of U.S. authorities  said on Friday he was seeking temporary asylum in Russia and had no regrets about spilling U.S. spy secrets. | Video

Headline: Winklevoss twins plan IPO for Bitcoin-tracking stock
Article: SAN FRANCISCO  July 1 The Winklevoss twins  who famously alleged that Facebook Inc founder Mark Zuckerberg stole their website idea  have  revealed plans for an IPO that will give investors exposure to the value of digital currency Bitcoins.

Headline: Seven Saudis jailed for urging protests on Facebook: HRW
Article: Saudi Arabia has sentenced seven activists from its restive Eastern Province to prison terms ranging from five to 10 years for posting messages on Facebook calling for anti-government protests  Human Rights Watch (HRW) said on Sunday.

Headline: Former police chief Bratton launches a social network for cops
Article: NEW YORK Bill Bratton  the high-profile police commissioner who has run three of America's largest police forces  is preparing to launch the first comprehensive social media network for police officers - a kind of Facebook for cops.

Headline: Judge scrutinizes Facebook deal to end privacy lawsuit over ads
Article: SAN FRANCISCO Child rights advocates tried to convince a U.S. judge on Friday that a Facebook  legal settlement did not go far enough to keep content created by minors out of the hands of advertisers.

Headline: Facebook ad products director to join online-payment firm Square
Article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc's director of advertising products has been hired by Square in a significant coup for the young online-payments company.

Headline: UPDATE 1-In search for effective ads  U.S. TV operators mine viewer data
Article: June 27 U.S. cable companies and satellite TV providers  locked in battle with broadcasters and online sites for advertising  are taking a page from Google Inc by using data on their subscribers' tastes to serve up tailored commercials.

Headline: CORRECTED-In search for effective ads  U.S. TV operators mine viewer data
Article: (Corrects in paragraphs 7 and 8 that DirecTV's ad targeting does not take into account specific TV shows viewers watch)

Article: SAN FRANCISCO  June 27 Facebook Inc's  director of advertising products has been hired by Square in a significant coup for the young online-payments company.

Headline: Facebook ad products director to join online payment firm Square
Article: SAN FRANCISCO  June 27 Facebook Inc's  director of advertising products has been hired by online payment company Square to oversee its point-of-sale product for retailers.

Headline: Former Oregon politician pleads guilty to Facebook IPO fraud
Article: NEW YORK Former Oregon gubernatorial candidate Craig Berkman pleaded guilty on Tuesday to defrauding investors by persuading them he could use their money to buy shares of Facebook Inc before the company's May 2012 initial public offering.

Headline: Former Oregon politician pleads guilty to Facebook IPO fraud
Article: NEW YORK  June 25 Former Oregon gubernatorial candidate Craig Berkman pleaded guilty on Tuesday to defrauding investors by persuading them he could use their money to buy shares of Facebook Inc before the company's May 2012 initial public offering.

Headline: Two Swedish teens convicted for Instagram insults
Article: STOCKHOLM Two Swedish teenage girls were found guilty of defamation on Tuesday for posting sexual insults about other youngsters on the photo sharing website Instagram.

Headline: Facebook admits year-long data breach exposed 6 million users
Article: SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc has inadvertently exposed 6 million users' phone numbers and email addresses to unauthorized viewers over the past year  the world's largest social networking company disclosed late Friday.

Headline: RPT-Facebook admits year-long data breach exposed 6 million users

Headline: Fund manager gets 11 years for Facebook  Groupon shares scam
Article: NEW YORK Former fund manager John Mattera was sentenced to 11 years in prison on Friday  after pleading guilty of defrauding investors of $13 million with a story that he put their money in Facebook Inc and Groupon Inc shares before the companies went public.

Headline: Yahoo's Mayer shines spotlight on video
Article: SAN FRANCISCO As Marissa Mayer approaches her one-year anniversary as chief executive of Yahoo  she's hewing closely to the struggling Web portal's traditional advertising model--and eyeing more video programming of every stripe as central to the strategy.

Headline: Indianapolis man charged with child porn in Facebook blackmail plot
Article: INDIANAPOLIS A 23-year-old Indianapolis man was charged on Thursday with child pornography  rape and coercing minors into sexually explicit conduct after he allegedly engaged in a year-long "sextortion" scheme on Facebook.

Article: Facebook Inc introduced video for its popular photo sharing application Instagram in an attempt to go to head-to-head with rival Twitter. | Video

Headline: Exclusive: Facebook reaches 1 million active advertisers
Article: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it now has 1 million active advertisers globally who used the platform in the last 28 days  a milestone for the company that is seeking to revive its revenue growth.

Headline: EXCLUSIVE-Facebook reaches 1 million active advertisers
Article: June 18 Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it now has 1 million active advertisers globally who used the platform in the last 28 days  a milestone for the company that is seeking to revive its revenue growth.
